channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from New Zealand and around the world on 6 May
item.description: Police Commissioner Andrew Coster says new legislation may be needed to set out the appropriate regime for police powers under alert level 2.

item.title: Watch: Epidemic Response Committee discusses palliative care
item.description: The Funeral Directors Association told the Epidemic Response Committee there needs to be a specific recognition to all of those who died during the lockdown, not just those who died from Covid-19. Watch the meeting here.

item.title: Covid-19: Golden Bay's lockdown experience
item.description: Golden Bay had almost everything Rebecca Hayter needed for the lockdown - but it wasn't all plain sailing.

item.title: Covid-19: Uncertain futures of museums and galleries
item.description: New Zealand's museums and galleries expect the funders they rely on will divert money into health and social services and away from cultural causes.

item.title: Transmission Gully project a 'circus', sections to be re-laid
item.description: The Transport Agency has admitted that sections of Wellington's billion-dollar project, Transmission Gully, need to be re-laid after an error.

item.title: Mt Roskill murder accused named
item.description: The man accused of murdering a woman in Mt Roskill last week can now be named.

item.title: Gang numbers on the rise, but a slight drop in gang crime comes with a warning
item.description: In the past two and a half years, the number of gang members in New Zealand has risen by a third, while gang crime has dropped by seven percent.

item.title: Unconfirmed sightings of barn owls in west Auckland
item.description: There's been a few ruffled feathers on a couple of West Auckland Facebook pages over the past week, with several unconfirmed sightings of barn owls.

item.title: Covid-19: Coronavirus developments in New Zealand on 5 May
item.description: New Zealand recorded no new cases of Covid-19 for the second day in a row, and PM Ardern met with Australia's Cabinet over the promise of trans-Tasman travel.

item.title: 'I refuse for our kids to be unemployed' - principal
item.description: Education leaders have warned Parliament's Epidemic Response Committee that students' education is suffering under the lockdown.

item.title: NZ, Australia Covid-19 lockdowns not as different as they seem
item.description: Despite the apparent differences, the lockdowns here and across the ditch still have similar impacts, some experts say.

item.title: Woman sentenced after receiving $150k in covert commissions
item.description: A woman who received $150,000 in secret commissions while employed at a tertiary college has been sentenced to nine months home detention.

item.title: Family dogs found poisoned in North Canterbury
item.description: A North Canterbury family have finally had positive news after their two family dogs were poisoned by an epilepsy drug on Friday.

item.title: Tourism Industry Aotearoa calls for special intervention for the sector
item.description: The number of people employed by tourism could halve without targeted intervention, Tourism Industry Aotearoa says.

item.title: Seven-month delay to Christchurch Southern Motorway
item.description: Another major roading project has been delayed for at least seven months due to the Covid-19 shutdown.

item.title: Live stream: NZ's Taite Music Prize 2020
item.description: Aldous Harding, L.A.B., and Troy Kingi are among the finalists this year, and Shona Laing will be receiving the Classic Album award. Watch live here.

item.title: Waitematā DHB creates work 'bubbles' to curb spread of Covid-19
item.description: Waitematā DHB is creating work 'bubbles' to limit movement of health workers dealing with Covid-19 patients, and there are calls to extend that across the country.

item.title: CTU calls for emergency benefit access for temporary workers
item.description: The Council of Trade Unions wants people on temporary working visas who have lost their job to have access to emergency benefits.
